instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01700: What is 820-01700? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP2V5_NAND_SSD1: What is PP2V5_NAND_SSD1? PP2V5_NAND_SSD1 is a power rail that powers the soldered on SSDs.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power with battery 19.7V 0.78A no battery. 19.8V 0.15A
threads.message:
Trying to fix this MacBook Pro (16-inch, 2019), but no success.
Under thermal camera i found short on <CHIP>U9080</CHIP> AND <CHIP>U8600</CHIP>
<SIGNAL>PP2V5_NAND_SSD1</SIGNAL>
<SIGNAL>PP2V5_SSD1_AGND</SIGNAL>
<SIGNAL>PP2V5_SW1_TPS62180_SSD1</SIGNAL>
<SIGNAL>PP2V5_SW2_TPS62180_SSD1</SIGNAL>
SO <CHIP>U8600</CHIP> IS SHORT IS IT FIXABLE

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power with battery 19.7V 0.78A no battery. 19.8V 0.15A
threads.message:
There are probably more NANDs damaged.
These machines suffer a lot from SSD problems.

You should need to change all NAND chips I suppose.
Sometime is possible to solder less chips, changing original configuration.
All you need to know about SSD configuration can be found on pages 2 & 3.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power with battery 19.7V 0.78A no battery. 19.8V 0.15A
threads.message:
i was only getting heat from the one is that a good sigh is it possible to change the one 
and thanks for every thing

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power with battery 19.7V 0.78A no battery. 19.8V 0.15A
threads.message:
That one has the lowest resistance to ground.
Once it removed, you may still get lower value than normal.
